page.title: 11YOUTH CULTURES IN BRECHIN
page.content: Over the last few years Brechin has seen the emergence of many youth sub-cultures, mainly in the form of gangs of teenage boys. The main groupings at present are the "Casuals" who are identified by being well-dressed in expensive shoes, trousers and sweaters. Dress is also the symbol of two other boy gangs. The "Mods" wear large anoraks decorated with Union Jacks and the "Bikers" wear motorcycle leathers. Other groups are linked together by common habits rather than clothing. The "Breakdancers" all specialise in the latest dancing craze and the "Bundies" are a group from the poorer part of the town who tatoo their arms. At a certain stage of emotional development many youths seem to need to belong to a group through which they express their personality.
